Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Joining Mirabaud, means entering an entrepreneurial and innovative environment. With the 7th generation of the Mirabaud family working within the bank, the culture is that of a family business. With over 750 employees based in 10 countries worldwide, Mirabaud offers opportunities to develop one‚Äôs career across an international network of 16 offices.

Mirabaud is proud to announce the launching of the largest project since its foundation in 1819, pushing ahead its highly regarded entrepreneurial and passionate team to the next level of client servicing thanks to the adoption of enhanced digital front and back-office capabilities. To support this ambitious digital transformation and migration to the cloud, our Data Hub, Reporting & MIS team is looking to add:

Job Description

A day in your future job:

  • Work with IT Application owners and Business Analysts to capture and define data Hub requirements;
  • Actively participates with our Data Architect in the functional and technical target solution;
  • Participate in the construction and evolution of our Data Hub (pySpark, Azure Synapse);
  • Participate in providing or extracting data from the Data Hub for various consumers (Client and Regulatory Reporting, etc.);
  • Respect the instructions and standards in place, design, perform and execute unit tests;
  • Organize and deliver trainings to the Application support team members;

Qualifications

  • Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer;
  • Degree in computer engineering or related field;
  • Very good knowledge of pySpark, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Synapse;
  • Knowledge of Wealth Management sector, an asset;
  • Knowledge of PureView and PowerApps, an asset;
  • Fluent in French and good command of English;
  • Creative, problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills;

Additional Information

Jump on the boat!

  • Family-friendly and dynamic environment;
  • Direct impact on the business, no matter your position or seniority;
  • Work in an environment that encourages autonomy and entrepreneurship;
  • Flexible working arrangements to help you achieve a better work-life balance;
  • Variety of cultural and sporting activities during your free time;
  • Inclusion and equal treatment;
  • Various employee benefits & family friendly benefits.

Title: SAP Master Data Analyst
Description:
A leading pharmaceutical company is looking for a SAP Master Data Analyst. This role is based in Basel, Switzerland.




Tasks & Responsibilities:

Create and maintain new material and product master data templates
Ensure availability of test data for upcoming SAP deployment activities
Coordinate with local SAP development team for data export/imports
Perform overall Master Data activities such as reporting, analysis, requirements gathering, etc
Join and/or complete Data Migration and Testing related workshops/trainings
Perform or ensure data cleansing tasks are completed on time
Complete data collection for manual/construction objects on time
Perform and confirm value mapping performed by the Deployment Functional Data Owners
Create and maintain master lists, if applicable, for assigned object
Provide business insights and information to technical teams for extraction and conversion from the legacy system(s) for assigned data objects
Ensure data readiness and verify quality throughout data journey for assigned data objects
Verify/validate that the data is fit for purpose (including alignment with internal/external stakeholders) and check upload files before and after load for all assigned data objects
Perform manual (type-in) data loads into target clients for assigned objects (if applicable)
Coordinate with local experts to collect and validate business requirements for material and product master data




Key Requirements




Bachelor's and University Degree in Business, Computer Science, Finance, Accounting, Education, Engineering, Business/Administration, Management, Information Systems, Information Technology
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Experience with Materials and Production Master Data
Experience as technical and functional tester
Tools and systems proficiency: SAP ERP (R3 & S4 HANA); SAP MDG-M, SAP DS/IS, SAP BW, BW/4HANA; SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau or QlikView, SAP Solution Manager
Excellent analytical mindset with ability to communicate data-driven insights and recommendations to key stakeholders
Strong communication, networking skills, someone who enjoys working with others and acts as a team player
Strong customer centric, solution-oriented mindset with the ability to propose different solutions for the customers‚Äô needs
Strategic and holistic mindset with the ability to manage topics in agile / matrix organizations
Familiar and comfortable with agile ways of working and adaptable to changing environments
English is a must
Skills with Excel Macros, Google office (e.g. G-sheets is a nice to have), database management







Its an urgent position. Apply soon!

Title: WIPO JPO - Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Important: Under the JPO programme framework, the following position is open only to nationals of the Republic of Korea. For detailed information on the JPO Programme and recruitment criteria, please visit https://www.undp.org/jposc


Organizational Context
Organizational Setting



This JPO assignment is in the Information and Communication Technology Division (ICTD) of the Administration, Finance and Management Sector. The ICT Department is responsible for the transformation of the organization‚Äôs information and communication technology systems and structures, with a focus on service excellence, quality, efficiency, and integration. The department oversees Enterprise Architecture, ICT Program Management, and Infrastructure Management including the ongoing adoption of cloud technologies.


Purpose Statement



The main role of the JPO is to participate in for data dictionary, data catalogue, metadata management, and data modelling activities. This post involves engaging with various stakeholders to collect and process IP and related data.


Reporting Lines



This post reports to Chief Data Officer, who bears responsibility on behalf of the Organization to promote value creation by means of the Organization‚Äôs data assets and external data ecosystem. As such, the CDO is the senior-most executive with the responsibility for aligning data policy and administration with relevant internal and external regulatory, legal, and ethical mandates.

Duties And Responsibilities

The JPO will perform the following principal duties:


Data Dictionary: Conduct a comprehensive review of the existing Data Dictionary (DD) capabilities within the organization. Identify and address gaps by developing new entries or updating existing ones to enhance relevance and practicality to the organization.
Metadata Management: Undertake systematic collection and documentation of various types of metadata, including technical, business, and operational. Document the data assets, their lineage, and provenance to facilitate better data understanding and utilization.
Data Catalogue: Design and implement a user-friendly data catalog. It will organize and manage information about data assets to streamline discovery and comprehension, ensuring both accessibility and clarity for users.
Data Modeling: Develop a visual representation of customer/applicant database focusing on effective organization and management of related data. This involves creating both conceptual and logical data models, particularly for Intellectual Property (IP) customer data within the organization.
Name Matching: Contribute to the development and implementation of name matching methodologies that enable statistical aggregation by individual applicants and the merging from IP data and others.
Other Related Duties: Perform additional related duties as required, including active participation in divisional activities, demonstrating flexibility and a collaborative approach to team projects and initiatives.



Requirements

Education (Essential)

First-level university degree in IT, Computer Science/Engineering, statistics, business management or in a related field.

Experience (Essential)

At least three years of relevant professional experience, including experience in data management and analytical skills.

Language (Essential)

Excellent written and spoken knowledge of English and Korean.

Job Related Competencies (Essential)

Ability to design data models and document data assets useful to the data community of the organization.

Ability to research and draft reports in a clear, concise, and logical manner.

Ability to communicate complex issues in written and oral forms.

Ability to plan, schedule and monitor work and meet time and quality targets.

Competent user of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), the internet, internet applications and tools used to validate XML and HTML.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multi-cultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.


Learning Elements



During this JPO assignment, the participant will develop a broad range of skills and knowledge in data-related fields, which will be invaluable for future career pursuits in any Intellectual Property Office or other relevant organizations.


Organizational Competencies
Communicating effectively
Showing team spirit
Demonstrating integrity
Valuing diversity
Producing results
Showing service orientation
Seeing the big picture
Seeking change and innovation
Developing yourself and others



Nationality: Under the JPO programme framework, the following position is open only to nationals of the Republic of Korea. For detailed information on the JPO Programme and recruitment criteria, please visit https://www.undp.org/jposc

Languages (required): Fluency in Korean and English.

Applicants should submit a Certificate of English proficiency test: Applicants should score a minimum of (i) TOEFL iBT 100 or (ii) TEPS 430 or (iii) IELTS 7 or (iv) TOEIC 900


TOEFL ‚ÄòHome Edition‚Äô score is accepted while ‚ÄòMyBest Scores‚Äô are not accepted
IELTS General Training and Academic test are both accepted
Test scores are valid for 2 years after the test date



Age Requirement: Not older than 32 years of age as of 31 December, 2024 (born after 1 January, 1992). The maximum age limit for those who served in the military will be extended accordingly:


One year will be extended for those who served for less than one year;
Two years will be extended for those who served for more than one year and less than two years;
Three years will be extended for those who served for two years or more.



Military service: Male applicants shall have completed the Korean military service or be exempted from it. Those who will be discharged from military service in the year of the application may also apply.

Attachments needed (please note that once the application is submitted in the system, you cannot go back to upload documents or edit information)


A copy of CV and brief motivation letter in English that explains why you're the perfect candidate for the position by using examples of your interests and achievements
A scanned copy of applicant‚Äôs Resident Register in English
Copy of your Bachelor's degree certificate in English
Copy of English proficiency test certificate. Please check the minimum requirements/scores above.
Only for male applicants who have completed the national military service: A certificate of Korean Military Service in English: The maximum age limit for those who served in the military will be extended in accordance with the Support for Discharged Soldiers Act and the Military Service Law.
Only for low-income applicants: A scanned copy of a certificate of National Basic Livelihood Security Recipients issued in Korean and its unofficial translation in English.
Only for persons with disability: A scanned copy of a certificate of person with disability issued in Korean and English.



Applicants can apply for a maximum of two JPO positions sponsored by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea during the year of application

For general information on the JPO Programme of the Republic of Korea, please visit the website of the International Organizations Recruitment Center, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea: https://UNrecruit.mofa.go.kr

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‚Äòleave no one behind‚Äô approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

Disclaimer

Important information for US Permanent Residents ('Green Card' holders)

Under US immigration law, acceptance of a staff position with UNDP, an international organization, may have significant implications for US Permanent Residents. UNDP advises applicants for all professional level posts that they must relinquish their US Permanent Resident status and accept a G-4 visa, or have submitted a valid application for US citizenship prior to commencement of employment.

UNDP is not in a position to provide advice or assistance on applying for US citizenship and therefore applicants are advised to seek the advice of competent immigration lawyers regarding any applications.

Applicant Information About UNDP Rosters

Note: UNDP reserves the right to select one or more candidates from this vacancy announcement. We may also retain applications and consider candidates applying to this post for other similar positions with UNDP at the same grade level and with similar job description, experience and educational requirements.

Non-discrimination

UNDP has a zero-tolerance policy towards sexual exploitation and misconduct, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles.

UNDP is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer that does not discriminate based on race, sex, gender identity, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, age, language, social origin or other status.

Scam warning

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

  • Three years will be extended for those who served for two years or more.


Military service: Male applicants shall have completed the Korean military service or be exempted from it. Those who will be discharged from military service in the year of the application may also apply.

Attachments needed (please note that once the application is submitted in the system, you cannot go back to upload documents or edit information)

  • A copy of CV and brief motivation letter in English that explains why you're the perfect candidate for the position by using examples of your interests and achievements
  • A scanned copy of applicant‚Äôs Resident Register in English
  • Copy of your Bachelor's degree certificate in English
  • Copy of English proficiency test certificate. Please check the minimum requirements/scores above.
  • Only for male applicants who have completed the national military service: A certificate of Korean Military Service in English: The maximum age limit for those who served in the military will be extended in accordance with the Support for Discharged Soldiers Act and the Military Service Law.
  • Only for low-income applicants: A scanned copy of a certificate of National Basic Livelihood Security Recipients issued in Korean and its unofficial translation in English.
  • Only for persons with disability: A scanned copy of a certificate of person with disability issued in Korean and English.


Applicants can apply for a maximum of two JPO positions sponsored by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea during the year of application

For general information on the JPO Programme of the Republic of Korea, please visit the website of the International Organizations Recruitment Center, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea: https://UNrecruit.mofa.go.kr

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‚Äòleave no one behind‚Äô approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

Disclaimer

Important information for US Permanent Residents ('Green Card' holders)

Under US immigration law, acceptance of a staff position with UNDP, an international organization, may have significant implications for US Permanent Residents. UNDP advises applicants for all professional level posts that they must relinquish their US Permanent Resident status and accept a G-4 visa, or have submitted a valid application for US citizenship prior to commencement of employment.

UNDP is not in a position to provide advice or assistance on applying for US citizenship and therefore applicants are advised to seek the advice of competent immigration lawyers regarding any applications.

Applicant Information About UNDP Rosters

Note: UNDP reserves the right to select one or more candidates from this vacancy announcement. We may also retain applications and consider candidates applying to this post for other similar positions with UNDP at the same grade level and with similar job description, experience and educational requirements.

Non-discrimination

UNDP has a zero-tolerance policy towards sexual exploitation and misconduct, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles.

UNDP is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer that does not discriminate based on race, sex, gender identity, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, age, language, social origin or other status.

Scam warning

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

Title: (Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst
Description:
You want A dynamic and challenging role in a globally recognized and expanding organization? The Opportunity to work with a passionate team dedicated to making a tangible impact on customer experience? This job is for you:

(Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst

Your mission

This role is critical in driving advanced reporting initiatives and optimizing data utilization to enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will possess a robust technical background in data analysis and dashboard creation, particularly using tools like Grafana and Data Mesh



Leadership and Initiative:Drive key reporting initiatives within the Customer Success team, demonstrating persistence and leadership to manage projects effectively.
Customer Interaction:Actively participate in customer conversations to gain a deep understanding of their needs and expectations, helping to bring insights directly from the frontline into our strategic decisions.
Data Mesh Utilization:Utilize the data mesh infrastructure to meet the specific needs of Customer Success, ensuring effective use of tools such as Grafana and similar analytics tools.
Dashboard Development:Create and manage standard CS dashboards as well as executive dashboards. Develop specialized dashboards for internal use cases as needed.
Collaboration and Development:Participate in the Big Room Planning (BRP) process for data-related topics, securing buy-in from Development teams and other stakeholders.
Technical Documentation:Support the creation .yaml files and documentation to facilitate understanding and usage of data resources.
UI and Report Development:Develop graphical user interfaces for report generation, focusing on prototyping and using PromQL to write efficient queries.
Optimization: Continuously improve the performance of data queries and systems to enhance reporting speed and accuracy.



Qualifications & Skills



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
At least 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role within a technology-driven environment.
Proficiency in Grafana, and/or other analytics and visualization tools.
Strong understanding of PromQL and experience in developing user-friendly graphical interfaces for reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to manage complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to clearly convey complex data-related concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working directly with customers to understand and fulfill their data reporting needs.



What we offer:

Want to join a team that enjoys making secure connectivity simple for our customers? You‚Äôll be among people who believe in:

Caring‚ÄØPASSIONATELY‚ÄØabout keeping our customers safe ‚Äì We‚Äôre dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking‚ÄØUNCONVENTIONALLY‚ÄØto stay ahead ‚Äì The world never fails to surprise us. So let‚Äôs surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things‚ÄØSIMPLE‚ÄØ‚Äì Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working‚ÄØCOLLABORATIVELY‚ÄØto build success ‚Äì The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognised as an outstanding place to work. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career.‚ÄØ

We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you need to compress your application into two attachments). Only direct applications will be considered.

About Open Systems

Backed by the Service Experience Promise, Open Systems simply and cost-effectively connects and secures hybrid environments and thus ensures your organization can meet business objectives. Open Systems uniquely focuses on a superior user experience when helping organizations reduce risk, improve efficiency, and accelerate innovation. The Open Systems SASE Experience delivers on the promise of ZTNA with a comprehensive, unified and easy-to-implement and use SASE platform that combines SD-WAN and Security Service Edge delivered as a Service. We provide 24x7 operational management and engineering support from assigned engineering teams and ensure affordable and predictable costs.

Discover more at open-systems.com.

Title: Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
Intern ‚Äì Data & Analytics




Location: Z√ºrich

Employment Type: Part-Time or Full-Time

Department: Quant Advisory

Internship Length: 6 months (open to also 9 or 12 months)




About Pexapark




The journey began in August 2017, when energy traders Michael Waldner and Luca Pedretti, together with software entrepreneur Florian M√ºller, set out to do their share in shaping the renewable energy transition.




Our Purpose ‚Äì We make renewable energy markets more efficient to accelerate the energy transition‚Äã.




Our Vision ‚Äì Be the global leader in market data, insights and services, enabling customers to succeed in renewable energy markets‚Äã.




Our Mission ‚Äì Empower clients with transparent, accessible market intelligence, innovative analytics, and facilitation of energy transactions.‚Äã




Pexapark is now looking to further expand its success story on the back of a recent 20 million EUR Series C funding round.




The Role




The Quant Advisory team is crucial to supporting Pexapark‚Äôs clients in making informed decisions about their energy transition needs.




As an Intern, you‚Äôll be working closely with the Quant Advisory team, and other stakeholders such as the Editorial & Analysis team, and the PPA Transactions teams to gather insights and analyse the data to come up with models for our clients.




This Data & Analytics internship position is ideal for a recent graduate looking to make the first step into their career, or a university student currently completing their degree.




How will you help:

Perform various data analytics of the historically observed patterns and relationships within the renewable energy power market
Research and prototype new kinds of quantitative models
Research about different markets characteristics (such as ancillary services, intraday)
Support on internal data analytics tool development




What you‚Äôll bring:

Experience working with data sets and performing analysis to identify important relationships and key insights
Relevant university degree in either Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Maths or Engineering (either completing your degree or recently graduated)
Strong problem-solving skills
Coding experience, ideally with Python or R
An interest in the renewable energy market data
A good sense of humour




How We Work




At Pexapark, we have our own way of doing things. The secret sauce that makes up Pexapark‚Äôs culture is made up of six ingredients:




Be an entrepreneur ‚Äì We have a bias to action
Deliver ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù ‚Äì What we do, we do well
Put the customer interest first ‚Äì We help our customers succeed
Be accountable ‚Äì Everyone at Pexapark is responsible for success, ‚ÄúIf it is to be, it is up to me‚Äù
Systemic and data-driven ‚Äì We evaluate our decisions for biases and overcome them through data and reflected processes
Be humble ‚Äì We admit when we‚Äôre wrong and don‚Äôt blame each other




We Offer




The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, supporting the transition to net zero
A highly flexible environment with hybrid working possibilities
Opportunity to travel to company and industry events
A fun scale-up culture made up of an internationally diverse team of renewable energy experts and seasoned professionals




We‚Äôre proud to have a truly international team where everyone can contribute and have their voices heard. Inclusive teams help to ensure every employee feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission, and able to progress in their careers. Our aim is to make our hiring processes as accessible for everyone as possible, including providing adjustments for interviews where we can.

About Pexapark


The journey began in August 2017, when energy traders Michael Waldner and Luca Pedretti, together with software entrepreneur Florian M√ºller, set out to do their share in shaping the renewable energy transition.


Our Purpose ‚Äì We make renewable energy markets more efficient to accelerate the energy transition‚Äã.


Our Vision ‚Äì Be the global leader in market data, insights and services, enabling customers to succeed in renewable energy markets‚Äã.


Our Mission ‚Äì Empower clients with transparent, accessible market intelligence, innovative analytics, and facilitation of energy transactions.‚Äã


Pexapark is now looking to further expand its success story on the back of a recent 20 million EUR Series C funding round.


The Role


The Quant Advisory team is crucial to supporting Pexapark‚Äôs clients in making informed decisions about their energy transition needs.


As an Intern, you‚Äôll be working closely with the Quant Advisory team, and other stakeholders such as the Editorial & Analysis team, and the PPA Transactions teams to gather insights and analyse the data to come up with models for our clients.


This Data & Analytics internship position is ideal for a recent graduate looking to make the first step into their career, or a university student currently completing their degree.


How will you help:

  • Perform various data analytics of the historically observed patterns and relationships within the renewable energy power market
  • Research and prototype new kinds of quantitative models
  • Research about different markets characteristics (such as ancillary services, intraday)
  • Support on internal data analytics tool development


What you‚Äôll bring:

  • Experience working with data sets and performing analysis to identify important relationships and key insights
  • Relevant university degree in either Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Maths or Engineering (either completing your degree or recently graduated)
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Coding experience, ideally with Python or R
  • An interest in the renewable energy market data
  • A good sense of humour


How We Work


At Pexapark, we have our own way of doing things. The secret sauce that makes up Pexapark‚Äôs culture is made up of six ingredients:


  • Be an entrepreneur ‚Äì We have a bias to action
  • Deliver ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù ‚Äì What we do, we do well
  • Put the customer interest first ‚Äì We help our customers succeed
  • Be accountable ‚Äì Everyone at Pexapark is responsible for success, ‚ÄúIf it is to be, it is up to me‚Äù
  • Systemic and data-driven ‚Äì We evaluate our decisions for biases and overcome them through data and reflected processes
  • Be humble ‚Äì We admit when we‚Äôre wrong and don‚Äôt blame each other


We Offer


  • The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, supporting the transition to net zero
  • A highly flexible environment with hybrid working possibilities
  • Opportunity to travel to company and industry events
  • A fun scale-up culture made up of an internationally diverse team of renewable energy experts and seasoned professionals


We‚Äôre proud to have a truly international team where everyone can contribute and have their voices heard. Inclusive teams help to ensure every employee feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission, and able to progress in their careers. Our aim is to make our hiring processes as accessible for everyone as possible, including providing adjustments for interviews where we can.

Title: Trainee in Data Analytics (80-100%)
Description:
Bist Du fasziniert von Daten und Analysen, und suchst den Einstieg in die Berufswelt? Als Trainee in Data Analytics bieten wir Dir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine ideale und lehrreiche M√∂glichkeit, die vielseitige Welt des Marktf√ºhrers von innovativen Imaging L√∂sungen w√§hrend 12 Monaten kennenzulernen. Als Trainee bist du Teil eines Data Analytics Team und agierst mit Unterst√ºtzung als wichtige Schnittstelle zwischen dem BI- /Controlling Team und der Service & Support Abteilung. Zu Deinen Aufgaben geh√∂ren unter anderem der Unterhalt von existierenden Datenbanken, Reports und Dashboards. Des Weiteren steht die Entwicklung von neuen Analysen entlang der Business Anforderungen im Fokus. Du √ºberf√ºhrst dabei die Anfragen aus dem Business in aussagekr√§ftige Reports und Dashboards, um die Transparenz zu erh√∂hen und m√∂gliche Verbesserungspotentiale aufzudecken.

Was wir bieten

Bei Canon f√∂rdern wir die M√∂glichkeiten, Neues auszuprobieren, die eigene Perspektive einzubringen und im Team Wissen offen auszutauschen. Deshalb suchen wir Menschen, die ihr eigenes Drehbuch schreiben und ¬´die Regie in ihrem Leben √ºbernehmen¬ª.

In Deinem Traineeship bewegst Du Dich zudem in einem inspirierenden Umfeld, in dem Du den Raum hast, Dich zu entwickeln und Deine Geschichte weiterzuschreiben. Du konzentrierst Dich dabei auf die finanz- und betriebswirtschaftlichen Auswertungen sowie die dahinterliegenden Daten. Du unterst√ºtzt das BI/Controlling-Team in der Datenaufbereitung- und Analyse (Sales Forecasts, Auftragsbestand, Durchlaufzeiten, ad hoc Reports), und arbeitest eng mit dem Business zusammen.

Nebst einem wertsch√§tzenden und tollen Team bieten wir Dir folgende Benefits


Flexibles Arbeiten Home Office, & Jahresarbeitszeit
Work Life Balance mind. 25 Tage Ferien & frei am eigenen Geburtstag, 40h Woche mit Kompensationsm√∂glichkeit, unbezahlter Urlaub & Ferienkauf, Corporate Volunteering Tag
Sonstige Benefits wie √ºberobligatorische Sozialversicherungsleistungen, erweiterte Elternzeit, Zugang zur Online-Lernplattform, internes Care Management‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ & noch vieles mehr, was wir gerne im Gespr√§ch erz√§hlen.


Wen wir suchen

Als motivierte Pers√∂nlichkeit verbindest Du Dein analytisches und vernetztes Denken mit einer Portion Neugier und Eigeninitiative. Du bist bereit, Neues zu lernen und auch Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen, um etwas bewegen und gestalten zu k√∂nnen. Deine guten Kommunikationsf√§higkeiten helfen Dir dabei, Dich zielgruppengerecht auszudr√ºcken.

Qualifikationen & Kompetenzen


Hochschulabschluss (Bachelor/Master) in Data Science Studium oder vergleichbare qualifizierte Ausbildung
Erste Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Stelle von Vorteil
Unternehmerische und l√∂sungsorientierte Denk- und Handlungsweise
Selbstst√§ndige Arbeitsweise und aktives Mitdenken
Strukturierte Pers√∂nlichkeit mit ausgepr√§gter analytischer Arbeitsweise und kommunikativen Skills
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (in Wort und Schrift), Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil
Kenntnisse im Aufbau und Unterhalt von Datenbanken (SQL, Access) und Dashboards (PowerBI, Oracle DV, o.√§.) sind ein Muss.
Gute Kenntnisse in Excel und mit der Microsoft-Umgebung sind erw√ºnscht, Erfahrungen in der Oracle-Umgebung (R12, OAS, DV) ein Plus


Auf dem Weg zu unseren Unternehmenszielen brauchen wir Menschen, die mit uns die Zukunft gestalten und die zu den Regisseuren einer sinnhaften Karriere werden wollen, indem wir ein Arbeitsumfeld bieten, das von einer starken Philosophie (Kyosei) getragen ist. Jetzt ist es Zeit, gemeinsam Geschichte zu schreiben.Living and working together for the common good.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our Pharmaceutical client based in Basel we are looking for a highly motivated Data Engineer focusing on developing and maintaining data workflow.
The mission of team is to enablethe companies scientists to access and work with research data generated during early lead identification and optimization campaigns.

The perfect candidate has 4 years of experience in data and workflow engineering. Additionally, the person is experienced in data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling. Experience with Python and SQL is required. Lastly, the candidate communicates fluently in English.

General Information:
* Start date: 15.08.2024
* latest Start Date: 01.11.2024
* Planned duration: 6 months
* Extension: possible
* Workplace: Basel
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office: partially remote, partially in Basel


Tasks & Responsibilities:

Developing a robust light-weight framework for creating data products based on an existing prototype that extracts data from multiple sources and creates data visualizations as the output
Creating automated extraction and loading processes from key databases
Creating easy-to-maintain transformations using DBT
Enabling a data storage solution and consumption by users via API or GUI
Developing, maintaining and documenting a solid codebase that we can turn into a self-service framework


Must Haves:

Min. vocational training
3-6 years of experience in data and workflow engineering skills (ETL/ELT principles)
Experience with data integration using warehouses, data lakes and database modeling (Snowflake, Postgres etc.)
Experience with Python for data extraction scripts
Experience with SQL for data extraction from internal databases
Experience with PostgreSQL for persistence of final product data, AWS S3 as a staging layer, Gitlab for CI, task and code tracking
A passion for working in an environment with high urgency, and you love to spend most of your time writing code
Enjoying operational side of things, like managing cloud-based infrastructure, workflow orchestration (e.g. GitLab CI/CD) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Interest in understanding biomedical or preclinical research data or have previously worked in a Pharma domain
Excellent communication skills in English


Nice to Have:

DBT for data transformations

Kindly send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Research Assistant (VLBI Data Analysis)
Description:
100%

The Satellite Geodesy research group of the Astronomical Institute of the University of Bern (AIUB) offers the position of a Research Assistant.

The focus of the activities will be in the field of extending the capability of the Bernese GNSS Software package for VLBI Data analysis.

Tasks

Based on the initial developments related to observation handling and the combined processing of satellites with quasars the full capability of an analysis center of the IVS (International VLBI Service for Geodesy and Astronomy) shall be established using the Bernese GNSS Software package. This development shall be carried out in a close cooperation with BKG (Federal Agency for Cartography and Geodesy, Frankfurt am Main, Germany). The activity is established within the framework of the institutional collaboration: ‚ÄúCenter for Orbit Determination in Europe (CODE)‚Äù. A refinement of the observation modelling is still needed. At the same time, the robust data processing procedure shall be developed allowing a highly automated VLBI data analysis. The development is supported by IAPG at TUM (Institute of Astronomical and Physical Geodesy; Technical University of Munich) where an initial prototype implementation was established.

The development shall allow in future research in the field of a combined analysis of VLBI and GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems) measurements ‚Äì in particular preparing the GENESIS mission. It is of course intended that the successful candidate shall start with scientific experiments in that field with the available functionality.

Education

The candidate is expected to have successfully completed the master thesis (diploma / ‚ÄúLizentiat‚Äù) preferably in astronomy, geodesy, physics, or a related topic. Experience in VLBI and/or GNSS data processing or in using the Bernese GNSS Software package, and in computer science (coding in modern Fortran, C++, or perl) are not a requirement, but an advantage. The candidate should be able to speak and write English fluently.

The candidate should start working in Bern as soon as possible.

The position is scheduled for three years. It can be extended depending on the progress in the project.

The salary follows the guidelines of the University of Bern and depends on the qualification of the successful candidate.

Application

Applications (including CV, University Diploma Copies, Possible References) Should Be Received As Soon As Possible But No Later Than August 09, 2024 At The Following Address

Prof Dr. Rolf Dach

Leiter Satellitengeod√§sie Gruppe

Astronomisches Institut

Universit√§t Bern

Sidlerstrasse 5

CH-3012 Bern

Phone: ++41 31 684 85 93, E-mail: rolf.dach@unibe.ch

Informal enquiries may be obtained at the above address as well.

The University of Bern is an equal opportunity employer and encourages in particular women to apply for open positions.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Legal Notice

Title: WIPO JPO - Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Important: Under the JPO programme framework, the following position is open only to nationals of the Republic of Korea. For detailed information on the JPO Programme and recruitment criteria, please visit https://www.undp.org/jposc


Organizational Context
Organizational Setting



This JPO assignment is in the Information and Communication Technology Division (ICTD) of the Administration, Finance and Management Sector. The ICT Department is responsible for the transformation of the organization‚Äôs information and communication technology systems and structures, with a focus on service excellence, quality, efficiency, and integration. The department oversees Enterprise Architecture, ICT Program Management, and Infrastructure Management including the ongoing adoption of cloud technologies.


Purpose Statement



The main role of the JPO is to participate in for data dictionary, data catalogue, metadata management, and data modelling activities. This post involves engaging with various stakeholders to collect and process IP and related data.


Reporting Lines



This post reports to Chief Data Officer, who bears responsibility on behalf of the Organization to promote value creation by means of the Organization‚Äôs data assets and external data ecosystem. As such, the CDO is the senior-most executive with the responsibility for aligning data policy and administration with relevant internal and external regulatory, legal, and ethical mandates.

Duties And Responsibilities

The JPO will perform the following principal duties:


Data Dictionary: Conduct a comprehensive review of the existing Data Dictionary (DD) capabilities within the organization. Identify and address gaps by developing new entries or updating existing ones to enhance relevance and practicality to the organization.
Metadata Management: Undertake systematic collection and documentation of various types of metadata, including technical, business, and operational. Document the data assets, their lineage, and provenance to facilitate better data understanding and utilization.
Data Catalogue: Design and implement a user-friendly data catalog. It will organize and manage information about data assets to streamline discovery and comprehension, ensuring both accessibility and clarity for users.
Data Modeling: Develop a visual representation of customer/applicant database focusing on effective organization and management of related data. This involves creating both conceptual and logical data models, particularly for Intellectual Property (IP) customer data within the organization.
Name Matching: Contribute to the development and implementation of name matching methodologies that enable statistical aggregation by individual applicants and the merging from IP data and others.
Other Related Duties: Perform additional related duties as required, including active participation in divisional activities, demonstrating flexibility and a collaborative approach to team projects and initiatives.



Requirements

Education (Essential)

First-level university degree in IT, Computer Science/Engineering, statistics, business management or in a related field.

Experience (Essential)

At least three years of relevant professional experience, including experience in data management and analytical skills.

Language (Essential)

Excellent written and spoken knowledge of English and Korean.

Job Related Competencies (Essential)

Ability to design data models and document data assets useful to the data community of the organization.

Ability to research and draft reports in a clear, concise, and logical manner.

Ability to communicate complex issues in written and oral forms.

Ability to plan, schedule and monitor work and meet time and quality targets.

Competent user of Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), the internet, internet applications and tools used to validate XML and HTML.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multi-cultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.


Learning Elements



During this JPO assignment, the participant will develop a broad range of skills and knowledge in data-related fields, which will be invaluable for future career pursuits in any Intellectual Property Office or other relevant organizations.


Organizational Competencies
Communicating effectively
Showing team spirit
Demonstrating integrity
Valuing diversity
Producing results
Showing service orientation
Seeing the big picture
Seeking change and innovation
Developing yourself and others



Nationality: Under the JPO programme framework, the following position is open only to nationals of the Republic of Korea. For detailed information on the JPO Programme and recruitment criteria, please visit https://www.undp.org/jposc

Languages (required): Fluency in Korean and English.

Applicants should submit a Certificate of English proficiency test: Applicants should score a minimum of (i) TOEFL iBT 100 or (ii) TEPS 430 or (iii) IELTS 7 or (iv) TOEIC 900


TOEFL ‚ÄòHome Edition‚Äô score is accepted while ‚ÄòMyBest Scores‚Äô are not accepted
IELTS General Training and Academic test are both accepted
Test scores are valid for 2 years after the test date



Age Requirement: Not older than 32 years of age as of 31 December, 2024 (born after 1 January, 1992). The maximum age limit for those who served in the military will be extended accordingly:


One year will be extended for those who served for less than one year;
Two years will be extended for those who served for more than one year and less than two years;
Three years will be extended for those who served for two years or more.



Military service: Male applicants shall have completed the Korean military service or be exempted from it. Those who will be discharged from military service in the year of the application may also apply.

Attachments needed (please note that once the application is submitted in the system, you cannot go back to upload documents or edit information)


A copy of CV and brief motivation letter in English that explains why you're the perfect candidate for the position by using examples of your interests and achievements
A scanned copy of applicant‚Äôs Resident Register in English
Copy of your Bachelor's degree certificate in English
Copy of English proficiency test certificate. Please check the minimum requirements/scores above.
Only for male applicants who have completed the national military service: A certificate of Korean Military Service in English: The maximum age limit for those who served in the military will be extended in accordance with the Support for Discharged Soldiers Act and the Military Service Law.
Only for low-income applicants: A scanned copy of a certificate of National Basic Livelihood Security Recipients issued in Korean and its unofficial translation in English.
Only for persons with disability: A scanned copy of a certificate of person with disability issued in Korean and English.



Applicants can apply for a maximum of two JPO positions sponsored by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea during the year of application

For general information on the JPO Programme of the Republic of Korea, please visit the website of the International Organizations Recruitment Center, Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea: https://UNrecruit.mofa.go.kr

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‚Äòleave no one behind‚Äô approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

Disclaimer

Important information for US Permanent Residents ('Green Card' holders)

Under US immigration law, acceptance of a staff position with UNDP, an international organization, may have significant implications for US Permanent Residents. UNDP advises applicants for all professional level posts that they must relinquish their US Permanent Resident status and accept a G-4 visa, or have submitted a valid application for US citizenship prior to commencement of employment.

UNDP is not in a position to provide advice or assistance on applying for US citizenship and therefore applicants are advised to seek the advice of competent immigration lawyers regarding any applications.

Applicant Information About UNDP Rosters

Note: UNDP reserves the right to select one or more candidates from this vacancy announcement. We may also retain applications and consider candidates applying to this post for other similar positions with UNDP at the same grade level and with similar job description, experience and educational requirements.

Non-discrimination

UNDP has a zero-tolerance policy towards sexual exploitation and misconduct, sexual harassment, and abuse of authority. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks, and will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles.

UNDP is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer that does not discriminate based on race, sex, gender identity, religion, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, age, language, social origin or other status.

Scam warning

The United Nations does not charge any application, processing, training, interviewing, testing or other fee in connection with the application or recruitment process. Should you receive a solicitation for the payment of a fee, please disregard it. Furthermore, please note that emblems, logos, names and addresses are easily copied and reproduced. Therefore, you are advised to apply particular care when submitting personal information on the web.

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.


Your Education And Languages Capabilities


Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.


Your technical Knowledge


Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Preferred Qualifications


At least 3 years in a similar role
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps


Your personal attributes


A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.


For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.
Show more
HTML:
We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst/Scientist to join our IoT Lab team, responsible for developing BOBST Connect, our all-in-one digital platform that enhances and improves packaging productivity. BOBST Connect brings data and digital services together in one fully connected cloud platform, with BOBST machine insights and expertise built-in, enabling overview and orchestration of the production process. You will be an integral part of the agile organization responsible for developing this innovative product, constantly evolving to serve our customers.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with our business stakeholders, IoT product management team, development teams, and other Data Scientists to define new products, services, and tools using data and machine learning. As a member of the team, you will work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from large and complex data sets. You will also be responsible for supporting the teams with data operational tasks.

Please note this is a hands-on role, involving a lot of data crunching: if you are looking for a management or supervisory position, this is not for you, as we strive to keep a flat hierarchy with very productive and operational teams.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and deploy data-driven solutions to answer a variety of business problems (predictive maintenance, equipment lifecycle analysis, etc.)
  • Understand the requirements of product owners and provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis.
  • Work on the development of data models, algorithms, and statistical analyses to extract meaningful insights from complex data sets.
  • Design and implement data pipelines and data warehouses to support data analysis and reporting needs.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders.
  • Mentor and coach developers on best practices in data analysis, modelling, and visualization.
  • Keep up to date with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies, and apply them to solve business problems.

Your Education And Languages Capabilities

  • Bachelor in Computer Science or Data Science (Master or PHD a plus)
  • Full professional proficiency in English. French an asset.

Your technical Knowledge

  • Advanced proficiency in programming languages (ideally Python), and experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries such as Pandas and NumPy.
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as regression, classification, and deep learning.
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, or standard libraries (D3/Plotly/...).
  • Strong communication skills and ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications

  • At least 3 years in a similar role
  • Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Hive (experience with Databricks is a big plus).
  • Experience with cloud technologies (ideally Microsoft Azure).
  • Experience with Agile/Scrum disciplines based on Azure DevOps

Your personal attributes

  • A true believer in the value of data, with the ability to take ownership and deliver autonomously and proactively tangible results to the organization.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders, including very senior managers.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to identify patterns and insights in large data sets.
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to ensure data accuracy and completeness, while keeping solutions as simple and robust as possible.
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in an agile environment, including the ability to manage priorities and give regular reporting on ongoing tasks.
  • Continuous learning mindset, keeping up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning.
  • Ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.

For more than 130 years, and over 50 countries, BOBST has always been at the forefront of innovation and we want to accelerate connectivity, digitalization, automation and sustainability to make packaging better than ever.

BOBST is one of the world‚Äôs leading suppliers of equipment and services to packaging and label manufacturers in the folding carton, corrugated board and flexible materials industries. Join our highly qualified staff and together, let‚Äôs shape the future of the packaging world.

The production site of Mex, near Lausanne in Switzerland, is also the headquarters of the Bobst Group. It is the most important site, employing approx. 1500 passionate people.

It also trains each year roughly 200 apprentices. The site offers an idyllic work environment. In the countryside and close to major highways, it is also well served by public transport. It offers many amenities, such as a corporate restaurant, sports fields, a fitness and a nursery. The facilities have been recently renovated and represent a model for sustainable development.

Title: Data Engineer / Modeller 80-100% (w/m/d)
Description:
At Julius Baer, we celebrate and value the individual qualities you bring, enabling you to be impactful, to be entrepreneurial, to be empowered, and to create value beyond wealth. Let‚Äôs shape the future of wealth management together.

In this role you will be responsible for the implementation of methods and solutions to improve and strengthen access to data, data alignment, data reliability and quality. Responsible for analysis of data to implement and support data-driven business processes and strategic business decisions. Bring a wide range of technical skills to perform data analysis end-to-end, practical understanding of statistics, data visualization and presentation skills. You will collaborate with Chief Data Office and other stakeholders to implement the organizational data governance, data strategy, data management standards and principles, ensuring compliance and quality. Contribute to development of data models and pipelines for analysis, reporting and machine learning.

YOUR CHALLENGE


Apply data extraction, transformation and loading techniques in order to connect and align large data sets from a variety of sources
Identify business problems when working with stakeholders, formulate problem statements and find ways to apply analytics to provide insight into solving and addressing the identified problem
Deliver ad hoc reporting and analytics to help in day-to-day and strategic decision making, present findings with appropriate visualization tools, e.g. Tableau
Build self-service solutions for users to access and consume data at any time, either as simple reports and summaries, or as interactive analytical dashboards
Contribute to the organization‚Äôs data strategy and data management standards
Implement and ensure process compliance to Data Governance, data policies and related requirements
Contribute to the development of global Common Data Models that can be used to make predictions and answer questions for the overall business
Build data pipelines that prepare, cleanse, transform, aggregate and enhance large data sets from a variety of sources


YOUR PROFILE


Degree in Information Technology, Economics, Finance or other related fields
Solid experience with SQL and databases, so as with ETL software (e.g. Informatica, Dataiku, Alteryx) is a must
Experience with BI software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI), Python, R or SAS would be a plus
ML Ops practical experience
Fluent in English and German
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent understanding of data concepts within business context - data models, data flows, interfaces, data alignment, data quality, data distribution, data security
Understanding of statistical analysis, pattern recognition, predictive modelling and machine learning considered as preferred qualification.
Understanding of key business processes within the domain of work (e.g. Finance, CRM, Core Banking, Banking Operations)
Proven communication skill with the ability to decompose complex solutions and data insights into compelling storylines, align and co-create with employees and stakeholders across different business domains and management levels


We are looking forward to receiving your full job application through our online application tool. Further interesting job opportunities can be found on our Career site.

Is this not quite what you are looking for? Set up a job alert by creating a candidate account here.

Title: (Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst
Description:
You want A dynamic and challenging role in a globally recognized and expanding organization? The Opportunity to work with a passionate team dedicated to making a tangible impact on customer experience? This job is for you:

(Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst

Your mission

This role is critical in driving advanced reporting initiatives and optimizing data utilization to enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will possess a robust technical background in data analysis and dashboard creation, particularly using tools like Grafana and Data Mesh



Leadership and Initiative:Drive key reporting initiatives within the Customer Success team, demonstrating persistence and leadership to manage projects effectively.
Customer Interaction:Actively participate in customer conversations to gain a deep understanding of their needs and expectations, helping to bring insights directly from the frontline into our strategic decisions.
Data Mesh Utilization:Utilize the data mesh infrastructure to meet the specific needs of Customer Success, ensuring effective use of tools such as Grafana and similar analytics tools.
Dashboard Development:Create and manage standard CS dashboards as well as executive dashboards. Develop specialized dashboards for internal use cases as needed.
Collaboration and Development:Participate in the Big Room Planning (BRP) process for data-related topics, securing buy-in from Development teams and other stakeholders.
Technical Documentation:Support the creation .yaml files and documentation to facilitate understanding and usage of data resources.
UI and Report Development:Develop graphical user interfaces for report generation, focusing on prototyping and using PromQL to write efficient queries.
Optimization: Continuously improve the performance of data queries and systems to enhance reporting speed and accuracy.



Qualifications & Skills



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
At least 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role within a technology-driven environment.
Proficiency in Grafana, and/or other analytics and visualization tools.
Strong understanding of PromQL and experience in developing user-friendly graphical interfaces for reporting.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to manage complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to clearly convey complex data-related concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working directly with customers to understand and fulfill their data reporting needs.



What we offer:

Want to join a team that enjoys making secure connectivity simple for our customers? You‚Äôll be among people who believe in:

Caring‚ÄØPASSIONATELY‚ÄØabout keeping our customers safe ‚Äì We‚Äôre dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking‚ÄØUNCONVENTIONALLY‚ÄØto stay ahead ‚Äì The world never fails to surprise us. So let‚Äôs surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things‚ÄØSIMPLE‚ÄØ‚Äì Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working‚ÄØCOLLABORATIVELY‚ÄØto build success ‚Äì The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognised as an outstanding place to work. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career.‚ÄØ

We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you need to compress your application into two attachments). Only direct applications will be considered.

About Open Systems

Backed by the Service Experience Promise, Open Systems simply and cost-effectively connects and secures hybrid environments and thus ensures your organization can meet business objectives. Open Systems uniquely focuses on a superior user experience when helping organizations reduce risk, improve efficiency, and accelerate innovation. The Open Systems SASE Experience delivers on the promise of ZTNA with a comprehensive, unified and easy-to-implement and use SASE platform that combines SD-WAN and Security Service Edge delivered as a Service. We provide 24x7 operational management and engineering support from assigned engineering teams and ensure affordable and predictable costs.

Discover more at open-systems.com.

HTML:
You want A dynamic and challenging role in a globally recognized and expanding organization? The Opportunity to work with a passionate team dedicated to making a tangible impact on customer experience? This job is for you:

(Senior) Customer Success Data Analyst

Your mission

This role is critical in driving advanced reporting initiatives and optimizing data utilization to enhance customer experiences. The ideal candidate will possess a robust technical background in data analysis and dashboard creation, particularly using tools like Grafana and Data Mesh


  • Leadership and Initiative:Drive key reporting initiatives within the Customer Success team, demonstrating persistence and leadership to manage projects effectively.
  • Customer Interaction:Actively participate in customer conversations to gain a deep understanding of their needs and expectations, helping to bring insights directly from the frontline into our strategic decisions.
  • Data Mesh Utilization:Utilize the data mesh infrastructure to meet the specific needs of Customer Success, ensuring effective use of tools such as Grafana and similar analytics tools.
  • Dashboard Development:Create and manage standard CS dashboards as well as executive dashboards. Develop specialized dashboards for internal use cases as needed.
  • Collaboration and Development:Participate in the Big Room Planning (BRP) process for data-related topics, securing buy-in from Development teams and other stakeholders.
  • Technical Documentation:Support the creation .yaml files and documentation to facilitate understanding and usage of data resources.
  • UI and Report Development:Develop graphical user interfaces for report generation, focusing on prototyping and using PromQL to write efficient queries.
  • Optimization: Continuously improve the performance of data queries and systems to enhance reporting speed and accuracy.


Qualifications & Skills


  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • At least 2-5 years of experience in a reporting or data analyst role within a technology-driven environment.
  • Proficiency in Grafana, and/or other analytics and visualization tools.
  • Strong understanding of PromQL and experience in developing user-friendly graphical interfaces for reporting.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to manage complex datasets and extract actionable insights.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with an ability to clearly convey complex data-related concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience working directly with customers to understand and fulfill their data reporting needs.


What we offer:

Want to join a team that enjoys making secure connectivity simple for our customers? You‚Äôll be among people who believe in:

Caring‚ÄØPASSIONATELY‚ÄØabout keeping our customers safe ‚Äì We‚Äôre dedicated to solving problems. Whatever it takes.

Thinking‚ÄØUNCONVENTIONALLY‚ÄØto stay ahead ‚Äì The world never fails to surprise us. So let‚Äôs surprise it first.

Doing the hard work to make things‚ÄØSIMPLE‚ÄØ‚Äì Craft and hone something that delights in its simplicity.

Working‚ÄØCOLLABORATIVELY‚ÄØto build success ‚Äì The power of the team will always make us faster and better.

As a testament to this, Open Systems has been recognised as an outstanding place to work. You‚Äôll be surrounded by smart teams who enrich your experience and provide opportunities you will need to develop your skills and advance your career.‚ÄØ

We look forward to receiving your online application (please note that you need to compress your application into two attachments). Only direct applications will be considered.

About Open Systems

Backed by the Service Experience Promise, Open Systems simply and cost-effectively connects and secures hybrid environments and thus ensures your organization can meet business objectives. Open Systems uniquely focuses on a superior user experience when helping organizations reduce risk, improve efficiency, and accelerate innovation. The Open Systems SASE Experience delivers on the promise of ZTNA with a comprehensive, unified and easy-to-implement and use SASE platform that combines SD-WAN and Security Service Edge delivered as a Service. We provide 24x7 operational management and engineering support from assigned engineering teams and ensure affordable and predictable costs.

Discover more at open-systems.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
FORFIRM is providing solutions to real business challenges for our clients through innovation and deep industry understanding. We pride ourselves on being a knowledge-based company, with no barriers or pre-built solutions ‚Äì we listen to our clients and solve their unique problems.

At FORFIRM, we are creating a culture where each person can define their own role parameters and speak their mind without any hesitation. We are a true meritocracy, where individual results define each person‚Äôs career path.

We are looking for an experienced and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our lively international team and work on projects for Europe's leading brands!

Responsibility


Implementation and monitoring of data to ensure integrity and accuracy.
Development and maintenance of data quality reports.
Design of logical and conceptual data models to meet business requirements.
Collaboration with data architects and developers.
Analysis of large datasets to identify trends and patterns
Collaborate on strategic data projects for BANK clients and serve as the primary contact for data preparation.
Take the lead in overseeing various technical reporting areas, including responsibility for enhancing the CRM data mart, data modeling, data governance and compliance reporting, and conceptualizing and implementing financial accounting reporting



Skills Required


Completed training in business informatics or comparable higher education
Several years of professional experience in the field of banking / financial services in the field of DWH / reporting
Expert in PL / SQL
Phyton script languade experience
Expert in Power BI or similar BI tools
Organizational and conceptual skills as well as a structured and independent way of working
High service orientation and quality awareness in a very dynamic environment
Confident appearance and strong communication skills in English
Commitment to a culture of inclusion and appreciation of diverse perspectives



What We Offer


Opportunity to work on international multi-disciplinary projects for leading brands from day one
Highly meritocratic environment ‚Äì points-based bonus and promotion system
A focus on knowledge building with regular internal and external training opportunities
Flexible working hours and smart-working environment
Opportunities to travel and work abroad
Supportive and dynamic team



FORFIRM is an equal opportunities employer that values diversity within the company. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination about race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
